BiblioData.Title: DEVICE AND METHOD FOR OPTICAL LOCALIZED PLASMON SENSING

Applicant.Name: YEDA RES & DEV [IL]
YEDA RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT COMPANY LIMITED

BiblioData.Abstract: A device is presented comprising a multi-layer structure with a plurality of metal islands on the surface of a solid transparent substrate. The islands are coated by an ultrathin sol-gel derived silica film via self-assembled monolayer.

Claims.P: CLAIMS:

I. A device comprising a multi-layer structure with a plurality of metal islands on the surface of a solid transparent substrate, whereon said islands are coated by an ultrathin sol-gel derived silica film via self-assembled monolayer. 2. A device according to Claim 1, wherein said self-assembled monolayer is of a compound having the general formula (I)
Z-R-SiOxZ2(OH)3-, (I)

Z being a binding moiety that can chemically associate with, attach to, or chemically sorb onto the metal, and R is a linker moiety, 3. A device according to Claim 2, wherein Z is a sulfur containing moiety.
4. A device according to any one of Claims 1 to 3, wherein R is an aliphatic or aromatic moiety optionally substituted by a carboxy, carbonyl, amino, hydroxy or thio group.
5. A device according to any one of Claims 1 to 4, wherein said silica layer has a thickness of 0.5-20 nm.
6. A device according to any one of Claim 1 to 5, wherein said noble metal is gold. "
7. A device according to any one of Claims 1 to 6, having inherent stable optical properties and essentially unaffected following exposure to -aqueous or organic solvents, washing and drying.
8. A device according to Claim 7, wherein said optical properties are localized surface plasmon absorption.
9. A device according to Claim 7 or 8, wherein changes in optical properties are essentially a consequence of binding or release of an analyte to/from a surface of the silica layer.
10. A device according to Claim 9, wherein said surface comprises analyte binding sites.
II. A sensing device for sensing an analyte in a medium, the device comprising a device according to Claim 9 or 10.

12. A device according to Claim 1, configured and operable as a transmission localized surface plasmon resonance (T-LSPR) recognition interface in which changes in the SP band are attributed exclusively to binding/release of analytes to/from the interface, enabling sensing applications. 13. A device according to Claim 12, configured and operable as a sensor based on T-LSPR mode and the optical response of said sensor is sensitive to changes in the effective dielectric constant of the immediate environment. 14. A device according to Claim 12, wherein said sensor is configured and operable as an optical transducer for chemical and/or biological sensing, 15. A device according to Claim 14, wherein said biological sensing comprises label-free recognition of biological molecules using selective antibody-antigen interactions.
16. A device according to Claim 14, wherein said sensor is an immunosensor configured and operable to selectivity differentiating between specific and nonspecific interactions.

17. A device according to Claim 12, wherein said silica layer is thin enough to afford high T-LSPR sensitivity, while the hydroxyl groups on its surface enable chemical modification for binding of receptor molecules.
18. A process for manufacturing a sensing device, the process comprising: (a) providing a solid transparent substrate with a plurality of metal islands on its surface;
(b) coating the islands with a monolayer of a compound having the general structure
Z-R-SiOxZ2(OH)3-X Z being a binding moiety that can chemically associate with, attach to, or chemically sorb onto the noble metal and R is a linker moiety; and

(c) immersing the monolayer-coated substrate in a medium comprising a silica-based sol-gel precursor and providing conditions for a sol-gel reaction to yield a silica film over said monolayer. 19. A process according to Claim 18, wherein the noble metal is gold.
20. A process according to Claim 18 or 19, wherein the silica film has a thickness of 0.5-20 nm.

21. A process according to Claim 18, wherein the coating is performed at temperature in the range of about 40<0>C to about 100<0>C. 22. A process according to any one of Claims 18 to 21, wherein the sol-gel precursor is sodium silicate.

23. A process according to any one of Claims 18 to 22, wherein said plurality of metal islands is formed on the surface of the substrate by an evaporation procedure. 24. A process for improving stability of surface optical properties of solid substrate carrying islands of a noble metal on its surface, the process comprising:
(a) coating the islands with a monolayer of a compound having the general structure
Z-R-SiOxZ2(OH)3-X Z being a binding moiety that can chemically associate with, attach to, or chemically sorb onto the noble metal and R is a linker moiety; and

(b) immersing the monolayer-coated substrate in a medium comprising a silica-based sol-gel precursor and providing conditions for a sol-gel reaction to yield a silica film over said monolayer. 25. A process according to Claim 24, maintaining a high sensitivity of the surface plasmon absorbance to analyte binding.
